Manifesto

A short explanation about what all these quotes are doing here, or a number of people are calling for change. We believe an ethical, sustainable society is possible and that psycho-education supported by practices like mindfulness meditation are vital to this conversation. Below you’ll find a number of quotes which link to their respective talks which provide context or rational to our work.

So, half is past, half is future. No present!
Dalai Lama

Sometimes people think that thinking is the opposite of mindfulness, but this can be just a way of escaping reality.

Junk values have taken over our lives and are making us mentally sick.
Johann Hari

The real causes of mental ill-health is social, not biochemical imbalance.

When everything is concentrated on making profits, what you see is that human rights, the environment, workers' rights get lost.
Andrew Morgan

The story behind the fashion industry - exploiting the poor and destroying the environment.

Reconnect body and mind
A six-week course

Fast fashion has turned us into these passive consumers who are constantly chasing the fantasy that buying more clothes will make us happy.
Clara Vuletich

We must learn to listen to others and ourselves to make fairer more sustainable world.

When you dream how to escape from reality you just reproduce the same world.
Slavoj Zizek

The message behind Holywood movies.

It's very difficult to know where power really lies in the 21st Century.
Yuval Harari

Neither the left nor the right have a vision for the future.

Practical and accessible
6 short guided mindfulness meditations for a busy life

To have a hope of changing the world, we're going to have to be willing to change both the culture as well as ourselves.
Naomi Klein

Trump is just a logical conclusion of a society shaped by Neo-Liberal values.

Either a new form of the Left will be reinvented or, here is my simple but I love it answer; or look at Hollywood. I always trust Hollywood. Hollywood is warning us all the time: Hunger Games, Elysium and so on. That's the society we are approaching. 20% of the people live in the privileged zone. The majority is out. That's the future.
Slavoj Zizek

Behind every rise of fascism there is a failed revolution.

To make a better world change has to more than a struggle to improve the lot of different minority groups
Nancy Fraser

I think every social movement has to precipitate a split in which we have to say we are done with the 'crack the glass ceiling' feminism, we're doing something else now and we're done with green capitalism and we're done with meritocratic 'crack the whatever they would call the ceiling' anti-racism.

Social change means we have to empower ourselves by challenging the stories that control us.
Gretchen Busl

The dangerous thing is that, myself and my fellow narrative scholars, are not the only ones who know about this narrative paradigm thing and that makes it very easy to manipulate and exploit us

There's now a feeling that nothing ever really dies but that's not good. That means that we are assailed on all sides by kind of zombie forms which persist forever.
Mark Fisher

Seeking a politics of time to wake up to the trap overrating the present.

This Lion-man crafted forty thousand years ago comes from a world that exists only in our imagination, yet he is here and his pricked-up ears are listening to us, his eyes watching us.
Neil MacGregor

The Lion Man is the first object created by humans that exists only in an imaginary world. It is the first object ever discovered that embodies a myth that can bind a tribe together.

Group mind and the individual
Understanding the evolution of identity

If a woman was emotionally isolated and stressed the risk of that lump being cancerous was nine times as great as the average.
Gabor Mate

We are alienated from environment, people, meaning and ourselves but it is possible to reconnect to our true nature by re-learning how to listen to our feelings.

How drug users are treated is often based on their socio-economic status or their race.
Vice News

Social change asks us to examine the facts.

Hippos would be repulsed by this. There's hardly any other species that has non-reproductive sex like this and nobody talks about it afterward.
Robert Sapolsky

We need to understand what it is to be a human being if we are to make a better world.

An evidence-informed approach
A self-study version of Mindfulness-Based Organisational Education

So, half is past, half is future. No present!
HH Dalai Lama

Description of quote/why quote is relevant to the agenda or manifesto

What do you do with the whole notion that crime and evil and guilt and punishment and criminal justice and none of those concepts make any sense whatsoever?
Robert Sapolski

We can understand the best and the worst in human nature as biological mechanisms but there is a point where we can't be rational about the meaning of life itself.

You may have heard of the term "Protestant Buddhism": It's a description to a lot of contemporary belief and practice. What is it and where did it come from?
Doug Smith

Mindfulness is as much something that has been created by colonisation in Asia as Asian culture itself.

Social Change
A different narrative

A state in which both objects and conscious experience cease altogether. It's a kind of vegetative coma.
Robert Sharf

Mindfulness can help reduce stress but some argue this is a form of escapism. Buddhists have also been highly critical of mindfulness as it developed in Asia.

Mindfulness is more like the large hadron collider in that it's a real tool for making some fundamental discoveries about the nature of the mind and one of these discoveries is that the sense of self that we all carry around from day to day is an illusion.
Sam Harris

Most people think mindfulness is a way of calming the mind or being in the 'present moment', but this is at best only half of the truth. Meditation is a tool to cut through the endless automatic train of thoughts and process strong emotions to see things clearly.

Our main intention was to bring the technique to the clinical areas around [surgical] theatres where the service demands and the stresses on the teams and the individual are greatest and where we felt that mindfulness or to be mindful would bring the greatest benefit to the Trust or to the teams as well as to the patients, ultimately.
Dr Conny Blunt

Mindfulness for hospital staff to improve wellbeing, communication and patient outcomes.

Narcissism and the mass marketing of mindfulness to the individual consumer go hand in hand.
Evan Thompson

Meditative introspection develops embodied understanding, which cannot be extracted from social and cultural context. Reducing the mind to a series of mechanisms that correlate with brain functions results in incorrectly applying mindfulness as a practice.

The only way I could see of really having some strong impact on [social change and sustainability] was to find a way of teaching meditation to a wide audience; to make everybody be able to engage in an internal process as a social process; to create a groundswell of systemic change in society.
Mark Leonard

To make mindfulness a force for social change it needs to be understood as social process.

Without this volume control system, you would be overwhelmed and psychotic. You would be flooded with sensory inputs.
Catherine Kerr

Mindfulness practice may involve developing attention and selectively filtering neurological noise but this enables us to tune into subtle heartfelt feelings with the thinking mind.

One of the things we noticed was that students who were participating a lot had different body language to student who were not participating a lot, who tended to be women and non-white men.
Amy Cuddy

By changing our body posture we can not only change the way others perceive us but change the way we think, feel and act.

Even well-intentioned white people have automatic associations from racial labels to racial stereotypes.
Diana Onu

Understanding how we automatically categorise people, connecting with people from different backgrounds and being motivated to go beyond first impressions can help us to free ourselves from seeing others in terms of stereotypes.

Which historical developments bring out our better angels of our nature?
Steven Pinker

Contrary to the popular impression view that we are living in extraordinarily violent times, rates of violence at all scales have been in decline over the course of history

I am doing my political and environmental work by cultivating this knowledge of the body.
Name of person being quoted

Description of quote/why quote is relevant

The self is not some membrane bounded entity. It is not the equivalent of my body or even my mind. What this research shows is that, whatever the self is, it's extendable. Selves only exist in relation to other selves and we need each other.
EvoS Seminar Series

Many of our problems come from our belief that we are separate psychological selves, but this is really an illusion.

So what this means is human mothers have an incredibly difficult task.
Alyssa Crittenden

Human beings need to live in communities and it takes a village to raise a child.

Connecting with others
Creating the social infrastructure of community
